faq.title: FAQ
faq.subtitle: Frequently asked questions about data conversion

what.question: What is Base64 encoded Excel file?
what.answer: Base64 encoded Excel file is an Excel binary file converted to Base64 text format for easy transmission and storage in text environments using excel to base64 encoding.

why.question: Why do we need format conversion?
why.answer: In scenarios like API transmission, database storage, email sending, Excel files often need to be encoded to Base64 format for processing.

formats.question: Which Excel file formats are supported?
formats.answer: Supports mainstream Excel file formats like .xlsx, .xls, and complex Excel files with multiple worksheets for base64 to excel conversion.

limit.question: Are there file size limits?
limit.answer: No file size limits for excel to base64 and base64 to excel operations. All conversions are performed locally in your browser without uploading to servers. Processing speed depends on your device performance.

safe.question: Is the conversion process safe?
safe.answer: Yes, all excel to base64 and base64 to excel conversions are performed locally in your browser without uploading to servers, ensuring data security.

preview.question: What are the limitations of the preview feature?
preview.answer: The preview feature limits display to first 100 rows and first 20 columns to ensure page performance. Complete data can be viewed by downloading the file after conversion.
